ygData.subject: Re: trade question
ygData.msgSnippet: LOL what did you expect?! It s effect is fire-based (obviously) and you are in a dungeon full of fire goblins... geez. On non-fire based critters it s effect
ygData.messageBody:
LOL what did you expect?! It's effect is fire-based (obviously) and you are
in a dungeon full of fire goblins... geez.
On non-fire based critters it's effect is resisted about the same as any
other proc in the game. My yaks are resisted just as much as my shard was
easily. I certainly hope no one thinks it is an uber-poker, though it is not
bad for a non-rogue to use as a piercer.

-Sartori D'Elsiraad <The Companions>
Bard of Quellious of the 50th Chorus
-Stace Stormraven
Druid of Tunare of the 26th Circle
Veeshan Server


>From: "Michal Hobson" <given@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] trade question
>Date: Thu, 2 Dec 1999 12:05:51 -0600
>
>Your info is quite correct. I got lucky and got the predator to drop the
>shard a few weeks ago. I used it for 2 nights and now its collecting dust
>in the bank. Its not only resisted a lot, forget about using it in Sol A,
>it's resisted damn near every time. I am rather surprised about the
>stamina
>problems that the initial poster of this thread mentioned. The scimi/dirk
>combo is the same setup I use, and I have yet to see my stamina drop more
>than a bubble. In fact, I often drop my dirk in my ranged slot and dual
>wield 2 OS's with very similar results stamina wise. Maybe its the group
>makeup I have, I imagine if you run in a caster heavy group, you would have
>that problem when mana runs low.
>
>Anyway, just to correct a post someone made yesterday or the day before:
>The Obsidian Scimitar has no proc but is + 6 AGI or DEX (I forget which)
>The Obsidian Shard has the proc - which is resisted WAY too much in my
>opinion, so if you get one, don't expect it to become the uber-poker you
>thought it could be hehe. I personally was very disappointed.
>
>Weiland
><Disciples of Truth>
>Erollisi Marr
